341    async def verify_deletion(self, original_doc_ids: List[str]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
342        """Verify that documents have been successfully deleted."""
343        remaining_docs = await self.get_all_docs()
344        remaining_ids = {doc["id"] for doc in remaining_docs}
345        deleted_ids = set(original_doc_ids)
346
347        verified_deleted_count = len(deleted_ids - remaining_ids)
348        still_present_count = len(deleted_ids & remaining_ids)
349
350        return {
351            "total_targeted": len(original_doc_ids),
352            "verified_deleted": verified_deleted_count,
353            "still_present": still_present_count,
354            "deletion_successful": still_present_count == 0
355        }

async def get_all_docs(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
65    async def get_all_docs(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
66        """Fetches all documents from the LightRAG server."""
67        try:
68            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
69                async with session.get(f"{self.server_url}/documents", timeout=30) as resp:
70                    if resp.status != 200:
71                        error_text = await resp.text()
72                        print(f"❌ Server error {resp.status}: {error_text}")
73                        return []
74                    
75                    data = await resp.json()
76                    all_docs = []
77                    
78                    # The API returns documents grouped by status in a "statuses" dict
79                    if isinstance(data, dict) and "statuses" in data:
80                        statuses = data["statuses"]
81                        # Iterate through all status categories (processed, failed, etc.)
82                        for status_name, docs_list in statuses.items():
83                            if isinstance(docs_list, list):
84                                all_docs.extend(docs_list)
85                        return all_docs
86                    elif isinstance(data, dict) and "documents" in data:
87                        return data["documents"]
88                    elif isinstance(data, list):
89                        return data
90                    else:
91                        print(f"⚠️ Unexpected response format: {type(data)}")
92                        print(f"Response keys: {list(data.keys()) if isinstance(data, dict) else 'Not a dict'}")
93                        return []
94        except Exception as e:
95            print(f"❌ Error fetching documents: {e}")
96            return []

Fetches all documents from the LightRAG server.

async def delete_documents( self, docs_to_delete: List[Dict[str, Any]], delete_source: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
 98    async def delete_documents(
 99        self, docs_to_delete: List[Dict[str, Any]], delete_source: bool = False
100    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
101        """Deletes a list of documents using the server API."""
102        results = {
103            "total_requested": len(docs_to_delete),
104            "deleted_successfully": 0,
105            "source_files_deleted": 0,
106            "not_found": 0,
107            "errors": [],
108        }
109
110        # Phase 1: Delete source files if requested
111        if delete_source:
112            print("\n🗑️ Phase 1: Deleting source files")
113            for doc_info in docs_to_delete:
114                source_path = doc_info.get("file_path")
115                if source_path and os.path.exists(source_path):
116                    try:
117                        os.remove(source_path)
118                        print(f"✅ Deleted source file: {source_path}")
119                        results["source_files_deleted"] += 1
120                    except OSError as e:
121                        msg = f"Failed to delete source file {source_path}: {e}"
122                        print(f"❌ {msg}")
123                        results["errors"].append(msg)
124                else:
125                    print(f"⚠️ Source file not found, skipping: {source_path}")
126            print(f"✅ Source file deletion complete.")
127
128        # Phase 2: Delete documents from LightRAG server
129        print("\n💾 Phase 2: Deleting documents from LightRAG server")
130        if docs_to_delete:
131            # Collect all document IDs for batch deletion
132            doc_ids = [doc_info["id"] for doc_info in docs_to_delete]
133            print(f"   - Deleting {len(doc_ids)} documents in batch...")
134            
135            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
136                try:
137                    # Use the DELETE /documents/delete_document endpoint with proper format
138                    payload = {
139                        "doc_ids": doc_ids,
140                        "delete_file": delete_source
141                    }
142                    async with session.delete(
143                        f"{self.server_url}/documents/delete_document",
144                        json=payload,
145                        timeout=60  # Longer timeout for batch operations
146                    ) as resp:
147                        if resp.status == 200:
148                            result_data = await resp.json()
149                            status = result_data.get("status", "unknown")
150                            message = result_data.get("message", "No message")
151                            
152                            if status == "deletion_started":
153                                print(f"   ✅ Success: {message}")
154                                results["deleted_successfully"] = len(doc_ids)
155                            elif status == "busy":
156                                print(f"   ⚠️ Server Busy: {message}")
157                                results["errors"].append(f"Server busy: {message}")
158                            elif status == "not_allowed":
159                                print(f"   ❌ Not Allowed: {message}")
160                                results["errors"].append(f"Not allowed: {message}")
161                            else:
162                                print(f"   ⚠️ Unknown Status '{status}': {message}")
163                                results["errors"].append(f"Unknown status: {message}")
164                        else:
165                            error_text = await resp.text()
166                            msg = f"Server error {resp.status}: {error_text}"
167                            print(f"   ❌ {msg}")
168                            results["errors"].append(msg)
169                except Exception as e:
170                    msg = f"An exception occurred during batch deletion: {e}"
171                    print(f"   ❌ {msg}")
172                    results["errors"].append(msg)
173
174        # Phase 3: Clear cache using the server API
175        print("\n🧹 Phase 3: Clearing server cache")
176        try:
177            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
178                # Clear all cache modes
179                payload = {"modes": None}  # None clears all cache
180                async with session.post(
181                    f"{self.server_url}/documents/clear_cache", 
182                    json=payload,
183                    timeout=30
184                ) as resp:
185                    if resp.status == 200:
186                        print("✅ Server cache cleared successfully")
187                    else:
188                        error_text = await resp.text()
189                        msg = f"Failed to clear server cache: {resp.status} - {error_text}"
190                        print(f"❌ {msg}")
191                        results["errors"].append(msg)
192        except Exception as e:
193            msg = f"Failed to clear server cache: {e}"
194            print(f"❌ {msg}")
195            results["errors"].append(msg)
196
197        print("✅ LightRAG server deletion complete.")
198        return results

Deletes a list of documents using the server API.

async def retry_documents( self, doc_ids: List[str], all_docs: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
200    async def retry_documents(self, doc_ids: List[str], all_docs: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
201        """Retries failed documents by deleting their server entry and triggering a new scan."""
202        results = {
203            "total_requested": len(doc_ids),
204            "retried_successfully": 0,
205            "not_found": 0,
206            "not_failed": 0,
207            "source_file_missing": 0,
208            "errors": [],
209        }
210
211        docs_to_retry = []
212        docs_by_id = {doc["id"]: doc for doc in all_docs}
213
214        print("🔍 Phase 1: Identifying documents to retry")
215        for doc_id in doc_ids:
216            if doc_id not in docs_by_id:
217                print(f"   - ⚠️ Document '{doc_id}' not found on server. Skipping.")
218                results["not_found"] += 1
219                continue
220
221            doc_info = docs_by_id[doc_id]
222            if doc_info.get("status") != "failed":
223                print(f"   - ⚠️ Document '{doc_id}' is not in 'failed' state (status: {doc_info.get('status')}). Skipping.")
224                results["not_failed"] += 1
225                continue
226            
227            source_path_relative = doc_info.get("file_path")
228            if not source_path_relative:
229                print(f"   - ❌ Source file path is missing for doc '{doc_id}'. Cannot retry.")
230                results["source_file_missing"] += 1
231                continue
232
233            # The file_path from the server is relative. We construct the full path
234            # by assuming it's within an 'inputs' directory inside the main storage path.
235            full_source_path = self.storage_dir / "inputs" / source_path_relative
236            
237            print(f"     (Checking for source file at: {full_source_path})")
238
239            if not full_source_path.exists():
240                print(f"   - ❌ Source file for doc '{doc_id}' not found.")
241                results["source_file_missing"] += 1
242                continue
243            
244            print(f"   - ✅ Document '{doc_id}' ({source_path_relative}) is eligible for retry.")
245            docs_to_retry.append(doc_info)
246
247        if not docs_to_retry:
248            print("\nNo valid documents to retry.")
249            return results
250
251        # Phase 2: Delete the failed document entries from LightRAG, one by one.
252        print("\n🗑️ Phase 2: Deleting failed document entries from LightRAG (one by one)")
253        deleted_count = 0
254        for doc_info in docs_to_retry:
255            doc_id = doc_info["id"]
256            print(f"   - Deleting document: {doc_id} ({doc_info.get('file_path', 'N/A')})")
257            delete_payload = {"doc_ids": [doc_id]}
258            try:
259                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
260                    async with session.delete(
261                        f"{self.server_url}/documents/delete_document",
262                        json=delete_payload,
263                        timeout=60
264                    ) as resp:
265                        if resp.status == 200:
266                            print(f"     ✅ Successfully deleted.")
267                            deleted_count += 1
268                            print("     ⏱️ Waiting 1 second...")
269                            await asyncio.sleep(1)  # Delay after each deletion
270                        else:
271                            error_text = await resp.text()
272                            msg = f"Server error during deletion of {doc_id}: {resp.status} - {error_text}"
273                            print(f"     ❌ {msg}")
274                            results["errors"].append(msg)
275            except Exception as e:
276                msg = f"An exception occurred during deletion of {doc_id}: {e}"
277                print(f"   ❌ {msg}")
278                results["errors"].append(msg)
279        
280        print(f"\n   ✅ Deletion phase complete. Successfully deleted {deleted_count}/{len(docs_to_retry)} documents.")
281
282        # Add a delay to give the server time to process the deletions before scanning.
283        print("\n⏱️ Waiting 5 seconds for server to process deletions...")
284        await asyncio.sleep(5)
285
286        # Phase 3: Trigger a server-side scan to re-discover and process the files
287        print("\n🔄 Phase 3: Triggering server scan to re-process files")
288        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
289            try:
290                async with session.post(f"{self.server_url}/documents/scan", timeout=30) as resp:
291                    if resp.status == 200:
292                        print("   ✅ Server scan initiated successfully.")
293                        print("      Documents will be re-processed in the background.")
294                        results["retried_successfully"] = len(docs_to_retry)
295                    else:
296                        error_text = await resp.text()
297                        msg = f"Failed to trigger server scan: {resp.status} - {error_text}"
298                        print(f"   ❌ {msg}")
299                        results["errors"].append(msg)
300            except Exception as e:
301                msg = f"An exception occurred while triggering scan: {e}"
302                print(f"   ❌ {msg}")
303                results["errors"].append(msg)
304
305        return results

Retries failed documents by deleting their server entry and triggering a new scan.

 90    async def _check_lightrag_server_status(self) -> bool:

101    async def _get_lightrag_documents(self) -> list:
102        """Get all documents from LightRAG memory server."""
103        try:
104            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
105                async with session.get(f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents", timeout=30) as resp:
106                    if resp.status != 200:
107                        error_text = await resp.text()
108                        print(f"❌ Server error {resp.status}: {error_text}")
109                        return []
110
111                    data = await resp.json()
112                    all_docs = []
113
114                    # The API returns documents grouped by status in a "statuses" dict
115                    if isinstance(data, dict) and "statuses" in data:
116                        statuses = data["statuses"]
117                        # Iterate through all status categories (processed, failed, etc.)
118                        for status_name, docs_list in statuses.items():
119                            if isinstance(docs_list, list):
120                                all_docs.extend(docs_list)
121                        return all_docs
122                    elif isinstance(data, dict) and "documents" in data:
123                        return data["documents"]
124                    elif isinstance(data, list):
125                        return data
126                    else:
127                        if self.verbose:
128                            print(f"⚠️ Unexpected response format: {type(data)}")
129                        return []
130        except Exception as e:
131            print(f"❌ Error fetching LightRAG documents: {e}")
132            return []
133
134    async def _clear_lightrag_documents(self, doc_ids: list, dry_run: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]:
135        """Clear documents from LightRAG memory server."""
136        if dry_run:
137            return {
138                "success": True,
139                "message": f"DRY RUN: Would delete {len(doc_ids)} documents from LightRAG",
140                "deleted_count": len(doc_ids),
141            }
142
143        if not doc_ids:
144            return {
145                "success": True,
146                "message": "No documents to delete from LightRAG",
147                "deleted_count": 0,
148            }
149
150        try:
151            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
152                # Delete documents using batch deletion
153                payload = {
154                    "doc_ids": doc_ids,
155                    "delete_file": True  # DELETE source files to prevent rescan
156                }
157                async with session.delete(
158                    f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/delete_document",
159                    json=payload,
160                    timeout=60
161                ) as resp:
162                    if resp.status == 200:
163                        result_data = await resp.json()
164                        status = result_data.get("status", "unknown")
165                        message = result_data.get("message", "No message")
166
167                        if status == "deletion_started":
168                            # Clear cache after deletion
169                            await self._clear_lightrag_cache()
170                            
171                            # Also delete the knowledge graph file
172                            await self._delete_knowledge_graph_file()
173                            
174                            return {
175                                "success": True,
176                                "message": f"Successfully deleted {len(doc_ids)} documents from LightRAG",
177                                "deleted_count": len(doc_ids),
178                            }
179                        else:
180                            return {
181                                "success": False,
182                                "message": f"LightRAG deletion status: {status} - {message}",
183                                "deleted_count": 0,
184                            }
185                    else:
186                        error_text = await resp.text()
187                        return {
188                            "success": False,
189                            "message": f"Server error {resp.status}: {error_text}",
190                            "deleted_count": 0,
191                        }
192        except Exception as e:
193            return {
194                "success": False,
195                "message": f"Error deleting LightRAG documents: {e}",
196                "deleted_count": 0,
197            }
198
199    async def _clear_lightrag_cache(self) -> bool:
200        """Clear LightRAG server cache."""
201        try:
202            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
203                payload = {"modes": None}  # Clear all cache modes
204                async with session.post(
205                    f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/clear_cache",
206                    json=payload,
207                    timeout=30
208                ) as resp:
209                    if resp.status == 200:
210                        if self.verbose:
211                            print("✅ LightRAG cache cleared successfully")
212                        return True
213                    else:
214                        error_text = await resp.text()
215                        print(f"❌ Failed to clear LightRAG cache: {resp.status} - {error_text}")
216                        return False
217        except Exception as e:
218            print(f"❌ Failed to clear LightRAG cache: {e}")
219            return False
220            
221    async def _delete_knowledge_graph_file(self) -> bool:
222        """Delete the knowledge graph file from LightRAG storage directories."""
223        from ..config.settings import LIGHTRAG_STORAGE_DIR, LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_STORAGE_DIR
224        import os
225        
226        graph_file_paths = [
227            os.path.join(LIGHTRAG_STORAGE_DIR, "graph_chunk_entity_relation.graphml"),
228            os.path.join(LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_STORAGE_DIR, "graph_chunk_entity_relation.graphml")
229        ]
230        
231        success = True
232        for graph_file_path in graph_file_paths:
233            try:
234                if os.path.exists(graph_file_path):
235                    os.remove(graph_file_path)
236                    if self.verbose:
237                        print(f"✅ Deleted knowledge graph file: {graph_file_path}")
238                else:
239                    if self.verbose:
240                        print(f"ℹ️ Knowledge graph file not found: {graph_file_path}")
241            except Exception as e:
242                success = False
243                print(f"❌ Failed to delete knowledge graph file {graph_file_path}: {e}")
244                
245        return success
246
247    def _vacuum_database(self) -> bool:
248        """Vacuum the SQLite database to ensure deletions are committed and space is reclaimed."""
249        try:
250            import sqlite3
251            
252            # Use the correct database file path that matches the agent
253            agent_db_path = self.storage_dir / "agent_memory.db"
254            
255            if agent_db_path.exists():
256                # Connect directly to the SQLite database and vacuum it
257                conn = sqlite3.connect(str(agent_db_path))
258                conn.execute("VACUUM")
259                conn.commit()
260                conn.close()
261                
262                if self.verbose:
263                    print("✅ Database vacuumed successfully")
264                return True
265            else:
266                if self.verbose:
267                    print("ℹ️ Database file does not exist, skipping vacuum")
268                return True
269                
270        except Exception as e:
271            if self.verbose:
272                print(f"⚠️ Warning: Could not vacuum database: {e}")
273            return False
274
275    def _get_semantic_memory_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
276        """Get statistics about semantic memories."""
277        if not self.memory_manager or not self.memory_db:
278            return {"error": "Semantic memory not initialized"}
279
280        try:
281            stats = self.memory_manager.get_memory_stats(
282                db=self.memory_db,
283                user_id=self.user_id
284            )
285            return stats
286        except Exception as e:
287            return {"error": str(e)}
288
289    def _clear_semantic_memories(self, dry_run: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
290        """Clear all semantic memories for the user."""
291        if not self.memory_manager or not self.memory_db:
292            return False, "Semantic memory not initialized"
293
294        if dry_run:
295            stats = self._get_semantic_memory_stats()
296            total_memories = stats.get("total_memories", 0)
297            return True, f"DRY RUN: Would clear {total_memories} semantic memories"
298
299        try:
300            # Get count before clearing for verification
301            pre_clear_stats = self._get_semantic_memory_stats()
302            pre_clear_count = pre_clear_stats.get("total_memories", 0)
303            
304            if self.verbose:
305                print(f"📊 Pre-clear: {pre_clear_count} memories found")
306            
307            # Clear memories using the memory manager
308            success, message = self.memory_manager.clear_memories(
309                db=self.memory_db,
310                user_id=self.user_id
311            )
312            
313            if success:
314                # Force database connection to flush and close
315                try:
316                    # Try to close the database connection to ensure changes are persisted
317                    if hasattr(self.memory_db, 'close'):
318                        self.memory_db.close()
319                    
320                    # Add a small delay to ensure database operations complete
321                    import time
322                    time.sleep(0.1)
323                    
324                    # Vacuum the database to ensure deletions are committed
325                    self._vacuum_database()
326                    
327                    # Reinitialize the database connection for verification
328                    self._initialize_semantic_memory()
329                    
330                    # Verify clearing was successful
331                    post_clear_stats = self._get_semantic_memory_stats()
332                    post_clear_count = post_clear_stats.get("total_memories", 0)
333                    
334                    if self.verbose:
335                        print(f"📊 Post-clear: {post_clear_count} memories found")
336                    
337                    if post_clear_count == 0:
338                        return True, f"Successfully cleared {pre_clear_count} semantic memories (verified)"
339                    else:
340                        return False, f"Clearing incomplete: {post_clear_count} memories still remain after clearing {pre_clear_count}"
341                        
342                except Exception as e:
343                    if self.verbose:
344                        print(f"⚠️ Warning: Could not verify clearing: {e}")
345                    return True, f"{message} (verification failed: {e})"
346            
347            return success, message
348            
349        except Exception as e:
350            return False, f"Error clearing semantic memories: {e}"
351
352    async def get_memory_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
353        """Get comprehensive status of both memory systems."""
354        status = {
355            "semantic_memory": {"available": False, "stats": {}},
356            "lightrag_memory": {"available": False, "documents": []},
357        }
358
359        # Check semantic memory
360        if self._initialize_semantic_memory():
361            status["semantic_memory"]["available"] = True
362            status["semantic_memory"]["stats"] = self._get_semantic_memory_stats()
363
364        # Check LightRAG memory
365        lightrag_available = await self._check_lightrag_server_status()
366        status["lightrag_memory"]["available"] = lightrag_available
367
368        if lightrag_available:
369            documents = await self._get_lightrag_documents()
370            status["lightrag_memory"]["documents"] = documents
371            status["lightrag_memory"]["document_count"] = len(documents)
372
373        return status
374
375    async def clear_all_memories(
376        self,
377        dry_run: bool = False,
378        semantic_only: bool = False,
379        lightrag_only: bool = False,
380    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
381        """Clear memories from both systems."""
382        results = {
383            "semantic_memory": {"attempted": False, "success": False, "message": ""},
384            "lightrag_memory": {"attempted": False, "success": False, "message": ""},
385            "overall_success": False,
386        }
387
388        # Clear semantic memories
389        if not lightrag_only:
390            results["semantic_memory"]["attempted"] = True
391            if self._initialize_semantic_memory():
392                success, message = self._clear_semantic_memories(dry_run)
393                results["semantic_memory"]["success"] = success
394                results["semantic_memory"]["message"] = message
395            else:
396                results["semantic_memory"]["message"] = "Failed to initialize semantic memory"
397
398        # Clear LightRAG memories
399        if not semantic_only:
400            results["lightrag_memory"]["attempted"] = True
401            lightrag_available = await self._check_lightrag_server_status()
402
403            if lightrag_available:
404                documents = await self._get_lightrag_documents()
405                if documents:
406                    doc_ids = [doc["id"] for doc in documents]
407                    clear_result = await self._clear_lightrag_documents(doc_ids, dry_run)
408                    results["lightrag_memory"]["success"] = clear_result["success"]
409                    results["lightrag_memory"]["message"] = clear_result["message"]
410                else:
411                    results["lightrag_memory"]["success"] = True
412                    results["lightrag_memory"]["message"] = "No LightRAG documents to clear"
413            else:
414                results["lightrag_memory"]["message"] = "LightRAG memory server not available"
415
416        # Determine overall success
417        attempted_systems = []
418        successful_systems = []
419
420        if results["semantic_memory"]["attempted"]:
421            attempted_systems.append("semantic")
422            if results["semantic_memory"]["success"]:
423                successful_systems.append("semantic")
424
425        if results["lightrag_memory"]["attempted"]:
426            attempted_systems.append("lightrag")
427            if results["lightrag_memory"]["success"]:
428                successful_systems.append("lightrag")
429
430        results["overall_success"] = len(successful_systems) == len(attempted_systems)
431
432        return results
433
434    async def verify_clearing(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
435        """Verify that memories have been successfully cleared."""
436        verification = {
437            "semantic_memory": {"cleared": False, "remaining_count": 0},
438            "lightrag_memory": {"cleared": False, "remaining_count": 0},
439            "fully_cleared": False,
440        }
441
442        # Verify semantic memory clearing
443        if self._initialize_semantic_memory():
444            stats = self._get_semantic_memory_stats()
445            remaining_semantic = stats.get("total_memories", 0)
446            verification["semantic_memory"]["remaining_count"] = remaining_semantic
447            verification["semantic_memory"]["cleared"] = remaining_semantic == 0
448
449        # Verify LightRAG memory clearing
450        lightrag_available = await self._check_lightrag_server_status()
451        if lightrag_available:
452            documents = await self._get_lightrag_documents()
453            remaining_lightrag = len(documents)
454            verification["lightrag_memory"]["remaining_count"] = remaining_lightrag
455            verification["lightrag_memory"]["cleared"] = remaining_lightrag == 0
456
457        # Overall verification
458        verification["fully_cleared"] = (
459            verification["semantic_memory"]["cleared"] and
460            verification["lightrag_memory"]["cleared"]
461        )
462
463        return verification

Manages the clearing of both semantic and LightRAG graph memories.

def get_all_tools( mcp_client: Optional[object] = None, weaviate_client: Optional[object] = None, vector_store: Optional[object] = None, logger: Optional[object] = None) -> List[langchain_core.tools.base.BaseTool]: 
 69def get_all_tools(
 70    mcp_client: Optional[object] = None,
 71    weaviate_client: Optional[object] = None,
 72    vector_store: Optional[object] = None,
 73    logger: Optional[object] = None,
 74) -> List["BaseTool"]:
 75    """
 76    Get all available tools with injected dependencies.
 77
 78    Args:
 79        mcp_client: MCP client for file operations and external tools
 80        weaviate_client: Weaviate client for vector operations
 81        vector_store: Vector store for knowledge base operations
 82        logger: Logger instance for tool operations
 83
 84    Returns:
 85        List of initialized tools
 86    """
 87    tools = []
 88
 89    # Import tools modules and inject dependencies
 90    from ..config import DATA_DIR, ROOT_DIR
 91    from . import filesystem, memory_tools, research, system, web
 92
 93    # Inject global dependencies into each module that needs them
 94    if mcp_client:
 95        filesystem.mcp_client = mcp_client
 96        filesystem.USE_MCP = True
 97        filesystem.ROOT_DIR = ROOT_DIR
 98        filesystem.DATA_DIR = DATA_DIR
 99
100        web.mcp_client = mcp_client
101        web.USE_MCP = True
102
103        system.mcp_client = mcp_client
104        system.USE_MCP = True
105
106        research.mcp_client = mcp_client
107        research.USE_MCP = True
108
109    # Inject logger into all modules
110    if logger:
111        filesystem.logger = logger
112        web.logger = logger
113        system.logger = logger
114        research.logger = logger
115        memory_tools.logger = logger
116
117    if weaviate_client and vector_store:
118        memory_tools.weaviate_client = weaviate_client
119        memory_tools.vector_store = vector_store
120        memory_tools.USE_WEAVIATE = True
121
122        # Inject Weaviate dependencies into other modules
123        filesystem.vector_store = vector_store
124        filesystem.USE_WEAVIATE = True
125        filesystem.store_interaction = memory_tools.store_interaction
126
127        web.vector_store = vector_store
128        web.USE_WEAVIATE = True
129        web.store_interaction = memory_tools.store_interaction
130
131        system.vector_store = vector_store
132        system.USE_WEAVIATE = True
133        system.store_interaction = memory_tools.store_interaction
134
135        research.vector_store = vector_store
136        research.USE_WEAVIATE = True
137        research.store_interaction = memory_tools.store_interaction
138
139    # Memory tools (require Weaviate)
140    if weaviate_client and vector_store:
141        memory_tools_list = create_memory_tools(weaviate_client, vector_store)
142        tools.extend(memory_tools_list)
143
144    # MCP-based tools (require MCP client)
145    if mcp_client:
146        tools.extend(
147            [

150                filesystem.mcp_write_file,

159                system.mcp_shell_command,
160                # Research tools
161                research.comprehensive_research,
162            ]
163        )
164
